alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Southern Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 4:32AM EST until January 17 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches, sleet accumulations of up to 1 inch and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Northern Penobscot, Southern Piscataquis, and Northeast Aroostook Counties. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 5 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the Monday morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow, sleet or freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Expect slippery roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Southern Piscataquis
